etymology.type: Unorthodox variant of 當 / 当 . From cursive script .
etymology.description: 尚(尚) (shàng, "still") + 田(田) (tián, "field") = fields facing each other -> to face directly; to be
etymology.interpretation: The character 當(当) (dāng, "to be") originated as a phono-semantic compound combining 尚(尚) (shàng, "still") for phonetic purposes with 田(田) (tián, "field") for semantic clues. The idea of fields facing each other represents facing responsibilities or a position directly. The simplified 当 is based on a cursive script of 當.
etymology.simplification: 当 is a cursive simplification of 當, streamlining the strokes for easier writing.

examples.chinese: 她当老师(她當老師)，辅导学生(輔導學生)。
examples.english: She works as a teacher, tutoring students.

examples.chinese: 我当志愿者(我當志願者)，服务社会(服務社會)。
examples.english: I work as a volunteer, serving society.
